input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Eating citrus has a direct effect on vitmain C. Vitmain C has a direct effect on scurvy. For patients not consuming citrus, the probability of scurvy is 17%. For patients consuming citrus, the probability of scurvy is 30%. For patients consuming citrus, would it be more likely to see scurvy if the patient had not consumed citrus?
